1.text: Paul, an Apostle sent not from men nor by any man, but by Jesus Christ and by God the Father, who raised Jesus from among the dead—

2.text: and all the brethren who are with me: To the Churches of Galatia.

3.text: May grace and peace be granted to you from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.text: who gave Himself to suffer for our sins in order to rescue us from the present wicked age in accordance with the will of our God and Father.

5.text: To Him be the glory to the Ages of the Ages! Amen.

6.text: I marvel that you are so readily leaving Him who called you by the grace of Christ, and are adhering to a different Good News.

7.text: For other “Good News” there is none; but there are some persons who are troubling you, and are seeking to distort the Good News concerning Christ.

8.text: But if even we or an angel from Heaven should bring you a Good News different from that which we have already brought you, let him be accursed.

9.text: What I have just said I repeat—if any one is preaching to you a Good News other than that which you originally received, let him be accursed.

10.text: For is it man’s favour or God’s that I aspire to? Or am I seeking to please men? If I were still a man-pleaser, I should not be Christ’s bondservant.

11.text: For I must tell you, brethren, that the Good News which was proclaimed by me is not such as man approves of.

12.text: For, in fact, it was not from man that I received or learnt it, but by a revelation from Jesus Christ.

13.text: For you have heard of my early career in Judaism—how I furiously persecuted the Church of God, and made havoc of it;

14.text: and how in devotion to Judaism I outstripped many men of my own age among my people, being far more zealous than they on behalf of the traditions of my forefathers.

15.text: But when He who set me apart even from my birth, and called me by His grace,

16.text: saw fit to reveal His Son within me in order that I might tell among the Gentiles the Good News concerning Him, at once I did not confer with any human being,

17.text: nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were my seniors in the Apostleship, but I went away into Arabia, and afterwards came back to Damascus.

18.text: Then, three years later, I went up to Jerusalem to inquire for Peter, and I spent a fortnight with him.

19.text: I saw none of the other Apostles, except James, the Lord’s brother.

20.text: In making these assertions I am speaking the truth, as in the sight of God.

21.text: Afterwards I visited Syria and Cilicia.

22.text: But to the Christian Churches in Judaea I was personally unknown.

23.text: They only heard it said, “He who was once our persecutor is now telling the Good News of the faith of which he formerly made havoc.”

24.text: And they gave glory to God on my account.
